question: Although you have never formally studied computing, you have always been interested in computers. You have just read about a computer course that really interests you, but it is only for people who have completed an elementary course.Write a letter to the college enrolment officer. In your letterexplain why you are writingdescribe your circumstancesask if a special exception can be made for you so you can enrol in the courseYou do NOT need to write any addresses.Begin your letter as follows:DearYou should write at least 150 words.
text: I am writing this letter to request enrollment in the "Python Expert" program you are offering in your college this fall. I would like to express my interest in pursuing this course.

Let me explain my circumstances in more detail. I understand that the pre-requisite for joining this course is to have completed at least a basic python program course. Though my mainstream education is not in computers and despite having the inclination to learn to compute, I could not devote my time to doing so; I suppose this could be a starting point for me.

Would you be kindly interested in making an exception for me? I can attend boot-camp sessions available online to make myself acquainted with the concepts and terminologies. Besides, I can use this skill to enhance my digital business operations.
Thank You for your consideration. I look forward to hearing from you.
